intro: Hieracium praetusum, commonly known as the purple hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its flowers are yellow with purple markings, and it produces numerous small, oval-shaped seeds. Hieracium praetusum is often found in open habitats and can be invasive in some regions.
